author: johnathan.lopez.a
title: WebApp: NodeJs COTI:ADA PaymentApp
description: Desenvolvimento de um aplicativo que ajuda a integrar em tempo real com o COTI-ADA Pay API. Isto torna efetivo o ADA de envio/recepção de WebApps & API.

f6_assessments.q0: This project effectively addresses the challenges in this fund.  It aims to develop a web app that utilizes the ADA Pay API and create a REST API for integration with 3rd party commerce sites.  The scope of the proposal does extend slightly beyond the challenge requests by aiming to develop a stakepool to support further efforts, but this will help scalability of the project through SPO efforts.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has the relevant experience to work on a project of this scope with firm background in programming, fintech experience and general Cardano ecosystem knowledge.  There is a breakdown of the spend for the funds requested and a rough timeline w/ milestones that are hoped to achieve.
f6_assessments.q2: The auditability of the spend is visible, but the timeline and milestones are a little vague and could be a little more descriptive or definitive.  This would help give the project some more transparency in terms of the development schedule.

f6_assessments.q0: Proposal effectively addresses challenge by onboarding ecommerce applications and milestones align with Challenge setting. It identifies the need for payment integration and if implemented successfully it should scale well as it will be a NodeJs App and highly compatible with already built ecommerce sites.
f6_assessments.q1: Evidence of relevant skills have been provided . Budget is broken down into identifiable items and seems reasonable to complete the project. The plan clearly explains how current payment systems work and how it will build and integrate into existing systems. They also mention the risk of not receiving support from WooCommerce when using their plugin. The timeframe to complete this project seems reasonable. They explain the necessary resources needed to build this with details like API integration.
f6_assessments.q2: A roadmap with milestones have been provided, but little to no KPIs. The 50+ successful transactions on testnet is a good KPI and some of the milestones can be considered KPIs, but it would be great to have more data to compare and measure performance of this project. They understand the problem of getting ADA payments on ecommerce and they know how to solve it. Good proposal overall.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a good proposal, with valuable ideas and intentions in it but that lacks a few important aspects. The objectives stated are aligned with the challenge settings and are addressed within the solution. However, not all explanations are complete enough to answer the most important questions. For example, how much user friendly the solution will be or how easy it will be to integrate with e-commerce platforms is not deeply discussed. Also, I felt that some key metrics were missing. The number of platforms that can be integrated, the ratio of transactions completed to total transactions and the total reach of the product are not mentioned and are very important to assess the impact of the project. There probably is some value to be added to the Cardano environment with this proposal but it is not that well-articulated in the document.
f6_assessments.q1: Enough evidence was given to support the skills and experience the team have in order to implement this proposal. The budget is broken down into identifiable items and the estimated costs are reasonable (even though they seem to add up to a slightly different value in total to the amount requested). The roadmap of the project is reasonable even though clear dates were not given, only the durations of the stages. Also, what is being done in each phase of the workflow is lucidly described, which is quite positive. However, the plan lacks the consideration of challenges and potential risks to a successful implementation. Additionally, some thoughts on what could be done if additional funding is necessary would enrich the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The information provided is sufficient to assess the progress of the project. The team has clearly stated what are the phases of the workflow and what is done in each of them. There is a clear understanding of what the problem is and what a successful solution would look like. Nonetheless more objective KPIs could have been constructed as they would help in auditing the advance of the project.

f6_assessments.q0: There is a clear problem breakdown and a solution provided. The proposal clearly articulates how it will add value to the cardano ecosystem in the plan overview section.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal introduces the team and provides their linkedin pages. They showcase several future usecases and in the section project workflow they provide a clear roadmap. They also explain in detail for which parts of the project they will use the funds.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal was perfect to assess it. It will be easy to check the progress of the proposal in the future since they provided all the necessary informations.

f6_assessments.q0:
I agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge. The problem statement clearly describes the need for having an app that wraps up the integration with AdaPay and provides merchants on ecommerce platforms to simply use this app via typical integration mechanisms that are available on platforms such as shopfiy.

However, for non technical voters/community members, it would have been better if the problem statement and solution is structured on a step by step basis, covering from a simplistic standpoint. e.g. a user of plugin does not really care if tech is node js or .net or java, what matters is if it works and easy to integrate. Similarly, for voters and community what matters is that they understand clearly why this solution is better than other proposed solutions to similar plugin development challenge ? 

Nevertheless, As a senior developer myself i like the idea of using a backend application (which they propose to do in Nodejs) to keep up for the scalability issues that might arise as wide adoption happens in the future.

An overall well written proposal but because some improvements are possible, i think one point less from my side.
f6_assessments.q1:
I agree that the team behind this proposal has the right set of skill set to fulfil the plan they have presented here. The linked in links are available and both developers have the web development experience and their chosen techstack is also the same. As a developer myself, i am sure that since they have worked with enterprise based applications, the software engineering practices are not alien to them.

The plan presented for this proposal here is quite elaborative. The proposer has given good reasonings on why they chose NodeJs to build the backplane for the webapp. The shopify integration steps and future changes presented in the attachment document present a good case that the proposer has done very good research on what needs to be done in order to implement this proposal successfully

It would, however, be nice from the team to give more detailed description on when they need what funding. The amount mentioned here does not have timelines associated with them. I am pretty sure they could split the budget distribution as their asking budget is 45% of total challenge setting.
f6_assessments.q2:
I agree that information provided here is sufficient to audit the progress and success of this proposal.

The project workflow presented here is split clearly in multiple stages and each stage is provided with detailed explanation. 

The community will not have any issues in tracking the progress of this proposal, as proposer has clear roadmap on when what will be done. 

The most important point for me is scalability and proposer has given good details on how they want to have good user feedback and keep supporting the project as more adoption occurs.

f6_assessments.q0: Looking at the proposal I can see the team knows has the knowledge of what they are proposing. Great idea to start with a payment app that is not bound to a single e-comm. The proposal aligns with the outlined challenge settings.
f6_assessments.q1: About the team, I have no suspicion that they are unqualified for this proposal. The experience they already have in banking apps secures any mistrust you should have. I really appreciate the R&D face in the project workflow, something that is usually missing in a lot of proposals. This is a key step for any project. One thing I have a concern about is the budget breakdown. The team asks for funding of 45.000 but in the breakdown, we come 5000 short. Where is the extra money needed for? One thing that could be the case is the contract with cloud servers since it is 5000/year but in the roadmap, you only talk about one year. Another could be the 6.6% of the budget that is being allocated to create a stake pool but that is not 5000.
f6_assessments.q2: Workflow of the project gives the sufficient amount of information needed to assess the progress of this proposal. What could've made this proposal solid is including some KPI's, these are missing here and are a great asset towards auditability. Think about what KPI you guys want so that performance of the Payment app could be assessed.

f6_assessments.q0: The WebApp: NodeJS COTI: ADA PaymentApp proposal addresses the COTI challenge using NodeJS App and REST web configurations.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer is experienced in Java and Javascript and TSYS payment. The proposal hasn't mentioned the background of another developer but mention about this developer #2 in the budget breakdown. The project staking pool development (around 6.6% of proposal budget) is deemed as a source for further funding in 2023 after the project launch date is August 2022. f6_assessments.q0: The proposal as it pertains to the salesforce and woocommerce integration meets the challenge requirements. Im not sure if funding a stake pool as part of the proposal makes sense. Its great that the project wants to become sustainable in the future, but to become a successful stake pool with a pledge of 1500 USD is unrealistic without an accompanying marketing strategy.
